intro: Leuzea cynaroides, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble a crown, typically blooming in the summer months. The plant grows as a perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody at the base. Leuzea cynaroides is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
